entries.title: As threats from the Trump administration mount, George and Alex Soros are giving out as many grants as ever
The Trump administration is quietly watering down some of the tariffs that underpin the president’s signature economic policy
President Trump has commuted the sentence of former Rep. George Santos, who is serving a prison sentence after pleading guilty to federal charges

Kurt Olsen, a lawyer who worked on the ’Stop the Steal’ effort to overturn the 2020 election results, has joined the Trump White House to investigate that year’s election and voting-related issues, according to people familiar with the matter
Salesforce Chief Executive Marc Benioff is apologizing for comments in which he called for President Trump to send the National Guard to San Francisco
The Justice Department on Thursday secured an indictment against John Bolton after an investigation into his handling of classified information
Funding for federal agencies lapsed beginning at 12:01 a.m. on Wednesday, after Congress was unable to pass a stopgap bill to prevent a government shutdown
Lobbyists are fighting to undo an 80% budget cut to Brand USA, a travel marketing organization created by Congress, as the industry warns of a decline in international tourism
President Trump said he reached an agreement with a drugmaker to lower the cost of medications used in a common fertility treatment
The U.S. Chamber of Commerce sued the Trump administration Thursday over hefty new fees in the H-1B visa program
Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker recounted his $1.4 million blackjack winnings when asked about a 2024 tax return
Maine’s Democratic Gov. Janet Mills officially launched a bid to unseat GOP Sen. Susan Collins, in what is shaping up to be one of the most competitive Senate races next year
Democrats were expecting to comfortably wrestle back control in Virginia next month. Instead, the local party has been thrown into crisis
Curtis Sliwa has six cats, wears a red beret and is running to be the next mayor of New York City. Many wish he wouldn’t.
President Trump said films made outside the U.S. would face a 100% tariff, repeating his threat made earlier this year against the movie industry
In “107 Days,” former Vice President Kamala Harris laments not separating herself from Joe Biden during her short 2024 bid for the presidency
The four-star U.S. Navy admiral in charge of U.S. Southern Command will step down as the Trump administration ramps up its military campaign against alleged drug traffickers in Latin America
President Trump has authorized the CIA to conduct covert action in Venezuela, an administration official confirmed
The U.S. military is making one of its most significant pushes yet into modern nuclear power with a program to put small reactors on Army bases
President Trump announced another lethal military strike on an alleged drug-trafficking boat off the coast of Venezuela, which killed six people
Qatar Facility at U.S. Air Force Base in Idaho Sparks Controversy
